name: Settlement Governments
content:
> @Compendium[sfrpg.rules.TN4VeY75Z2Ce8IT7]{Settlements}

Name Source Details
Anarchy CRB pg. 405

A lack of structured government or laws leads to a settlement where nearly anything goes.
Autocracy CRB pg. 405

 A single individual has complete control over the community.
Council CRB pg. 405

 A group of councilors, sometimes elected, sometimes self-appointed, leads the settlement.
Magocracy CRB pg. 405  An individual or group with potent magical power holds sway over the citizens.
Military CRB pg. 405

 A military force controls the settlement, whether it’s a regular settlement that has come under martial law or a base built to house soldiers.
Oligarchy CRB pg. 405  The settlement is ruled by a small group or particular class of citizen.
Secret Syndicate CRB pg. 405

An unofficial or illegal group rules the settlement, often behind the scenes while a puppet ruler appears to have nominal control.
Plutocracy CRB pg. 405

 An unofficial or illegal group rules the settlement, often behind the scenes while a puppet ruler appears to have nominal control.
Polluted CRB pg. 405  The wealthiest and most influential individuals rule the settlement, often while the poor are derided.
Utopia CRB pg. 405  The settlement was founded on a particular set of lofty ideals, and all members of the community usually have a voice in its government.
